comment.author: 81227438@N00
comment._content: It would be great if you can add this to Leichhardt Municipality Group. and invite others with similar captures

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content:
3/4 of the background of this picture is of Pyrmont/Ultimo.    Not Balmain !

The part behing the observatory is Pyrmont.

The plain dark area behind the bunch of tall ships is Glebe Island   and the hill behind that in the distance is what is now Lilyfield.    Balmain is not in the picture at all,   unless you consider Lilyfield to be the Balmain peninsula.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: This is another shot from the chimney and it is looking very much south-west,  not west.

comment.author: 48420463@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mich2009]  Help! I've had a play around with a few maps and I can't quite get my head around around the photo angle aspect. (Especially regarding the University of Sydney.) I did have a play with google maps to try and work it out but that left me agreeing more with the original caption. Can you point me in the right direction?

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content:
This is a shot from the chimney near Dawes Point.  It is looking south-west, not west.  The trinity church is in the middle of the shot.
All of the land in the background which you can see is Ultimo and Pyrmont.   The right background is Lilyfield.
You cannot see Balmain in this photo.   It is out of shot to the right.  If you look directly west from the rocks, you see East Balmain ( surprising close )  and Balmain beyond it.   
That is not what you see in this photo.   In this photo,  you are looking south-west, not west.
